explanation: The air map of the area is the most important item because it can provide crucial information about your location and the direction to the mining camp. Navigating correctly is vital in an extreme environment like the Atacama Desert, where the margin for error is very slim and can mean the difference between life and death. Additionally, being 65 miles off the originally filed Flight Plan makes the map essential for recalibrating your route and ensuring that you do not wander aimlessly in the harsh conditions.
